文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: The corrosion of Zircaloy-4 is accelerated in water or steam above about 350°C when LiOH is present in sufficient concentrations.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: A short-term test (16 h) to predict inreactor corrosion behavior has been developed based on this accelerated corrosion.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: A group of claddings with a range of in-reactor corrosion behavior has been tested in LiOH solutions from 310 to 415°C with Li concentrations up to 375 ppm.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: A group of claddings with a range of in-reactor corrosion behavior has been tested in LiOH solutions from 310 to 415°C with Li concentrations up to 375 ppm.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: Up to 100 times the rate seen in pure water was obtained in supercritical water with high LiOH levels.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: The best correlation to the in-reactor behavior was obtained for a Li content in the range of 75 to 190 ppm in the temperature range of 390 to 410°C.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: The best correlation to the in-reactor behavior was obtained for a Li content in the range of 75 to 190 ppm in the temperature range of 390 to 410°C.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: The corrosion rate for Zircaloy-4 in steam containing LiOH has been observed to be higher than in water with LiOH for tests below the critical temperature.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: For tests above the critical temperature, the corrosion rate was greater for samples which were above the initial water line in the capsule.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: The accelerated test with LiOH correlated well with 415°C/3 day autoclave test results for Zircaloy-4 but not for zirconium-based alloys containing niobium.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: Kass [1] measured the corrosion and hydrogen pickup of Zircaloy-2 in concentrated LiOH solutions at 315 and 360°C.

证据片段: Kass [1] measured the corrosion and hydrogen pickup of Zircaloy-2 in concentrated LiOH solutions at 315 and 360°C.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: He obtained very high corrosion rates with 0.1 to 1.0 N LiOH.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: Also, the hydrogen pickup fraction, which is the ratio of the hydrogen absorbed by the sample to the amount of hydrogen liberated from the water during oxidation, was very high (generally about 60%).

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: Murgatroyd and Winton [2] found the corrosion rate of Zircaloy-2 to increase significantly at 300°C in LiOH solutions.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
证据片段: Compared to the corrosion rate of pure water, the rate was increased by a factor of two with 5 g/L LiOH and a factor of 100 with 72 g/L.
